intro: Dianthera nuda, commonly known as the naked dianthera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Violaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in regions of Brazil, Argentina, and Paraguay. The plant is characterized by its simple, hairy stems and small, violet-colored flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its delicate appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species within its native habitat.
